sect1.title: Document Information
sect1.para: This document is a part of SUMO - Simulation of Urban MObility. SUMO is an open source microscopic road traffic simulation. It can be found under http://sumo.sourceforge.net/.
This document fits to version 0.9.5. We will try to keep it up-to-date with the next versions.

sect1.title: Document Scope
sect1.para: Since version 0.9.3 we support some basic tests which prove the software functionality. The number of the available tests is not that large, yet, but it will hopefuly grow with time. Ths chapter describes how to set up the testing system and how to use it.

sect1.title: Document Audience
sect1.para: This document contains information for developers who extend SUMO and want to assure their changes work properly.

sect1.title: Document Structure
sect1.para: At first, the acceptance tests that come with the package are described.

sect1.title: About
sect1.para: We use "TextTest" to test whether the sosftware still behaves as expected. What this application does is simply to compare an application's output (both normal and errors) and optionally also the files written by the application with previously generated files.

There are some advantages and disadvantages of this approach. On the one hand, you can guarantee that the application is doing what is wanted by comparing all outputs with files you think are right. But this is also the problem with this approach: you do not have the assurance that the files you are comparing the current outputs to ARE right - you have to check these by hand.
Anyhow, for the current progress stage, this approach should be used, because a) the tests are quite small and errors can be easily seen b) it is working.

sect1.title: Install
sect1.para: At first, you have to download and install "TextTest" from http://texttest.carmen.se/. The installation seems to be not that easy at first, but if you just follow the steps described in TestText's documentation, you'll have the system up and running in some minutes. Before continuing, please check whether the tests included with the TextTest distribution run before proceeding.
After installing TextTest, you have to set an environment variables in order to make the system run:
This environment variable forces TextTest to use the specified directory as source of tests.
This should be all on installing the tests-subsystem so far...

sect1.title: Running the Tests
sect1.para: Within the <SUMO>/tests - folder you can find batch-files which start TextTest. "runAllTests.bat" starts TextTest for testing all apllications located in the folder, "runNetconvertTests.bat" will only show tests for NETCONVERT, "runDuarouterTests.bat" only those for DUAROUTER etc.

sect1.title: Setting up new Tests
sect1.para: Please follow the instructions for TextTest. In the following, the TextTest configuration for each application will be discussed.

sect1.title: Coverage
sect1.para: As said before, further tests have to be added. The following tests are currently available:
